item.title: Newport Butterfly Zoo, RI - Tiverton, Rhode Island - Rare Specimens Can ...
item.description: Newport Butterfly Zoo, RI - Tiverton, Rhode Island - Rare Specimens Can Be Seen and Collected From This Colorful Insect Farm in Newport County The Newport Butterfly Zoo, RI, is located at 409 Bulgarmarsh Road in the town of Triverton n Newport County. It is about 20 minutes from the town of Newport. The zoo is owned by Mark Schenk since he opened it in 1992. In the warm months Schenk invites ...

item.title: Alexandria Zoological Park in Alexandria, Louisiana - City-Data.com
item.description: The zoo is owned by the City of Alexandria and encompasses 33 acres and has more than 600 animals. Alexandria Zoo is a member of the Association of Zoos and Aquariums and is open seven days per week and closed on Christmas Day, New Years and Thanksgiving. The zoo has some of the most unique and interesting exhibits in the country.

item.title: The Texas Zoo - Victoria, Texas - small public zoo with 150 animals on ...
item.description: The Texas Zoo originated in 1957 when a benefactor contributed a lioness to the Mayor of Victoria. The mayor approached the Lions Club and began the long process of creating a zoo for the city. Over the years, the zoo grew from a single lion in a cage to a small children's zoo to a full-fledged zoo housing over 200 animals.

item.title: Henry Doorly Zoo in Omaha, Nebraska - City-Data.com
item.description: Henry Doorly Zoo in Omaha, Nebraska The Henry Doorly Zoo is accredited by the Association of Zoos and Aquariums, and a member of the World Association of Zoos and Aquariums. The facility is composed of more than 130-acres and first opened to the public as the Riverview Park Zoo, in 1894.

item.title: Sacramento Zoo - Sacramento, California - large zoo with over 600 animals
item.description: The Sacramento Zoo is home to over 30 endangered species among its 600 animals. The zoo participates in international, national and local conservation efforts to protect a wide variety of animal species, including the Grevy Zebra, snow leopards and a variety of amphibians including the blue dart frog and the California tiger salamander.

item.title: Swetsville Zoo - Fort Collins, CO - a zoo without a single living animal
item.description: The zoo even managed to survive a flood in the area. Friends of the Swets created the displays in the Bungled Jungle. Getting to the Swetsville Zoo from Timnath is simple. Take Interstate 25 to the 265 exit south of Fort Collins. Travel down the Harmony Road heading east which is the right side of the highway until you reach the zoo.

item.title: Fun Spot - Angola, Indiana - Family-Oriented Amusement Park and Zoo
item.description: Fun Spot is a family amusement and fun park located in Angola, Indiana. It includes not only 24 different rides for young and old alike, but also a kiddie park, a zoo, waterslides, and arcades. The park is open on a seasonal schedule which typically runs from early June to late August.

item.title: Oglebay's Good Zoo - Wheeling, West Virginia - small zoo located at a ...
item.description: Oglebay's Good Zoo - Wheeling, West Virginia - small zoo located at a resort and conference center Part of the Oglebay Resort & Conference Center, Oglbay's Good Zoo was dedicated to the memory of seven-year-old Philip Mayer Good. The zoo has a number of small animal exhibits, as well as a planetarium and educational programs for children and their families. Children can participate in zoo ...

item.title: Walter D. Stone Memorial Zoo - Boston, Massachusetts - small public zoo ...
item.description: The Zoo is operated by Zoo New England, which also manages the Franklin Park Zoo in Boston, MA. Originally established in 1905 as Middlesex Fells Zoo, the park was renamed in honor of long-time zoo director Walter D. Stone in 1969.

item.title: Which zoo is better, Riverbanks Zoo (Columbia, SC) or the North ...
item.description: I have only been to the one in Asheboro (more than 10 years ago), but would like know which one is bigger/better.
